text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt with Jacob; each one came in with his household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph died and all his brethren and all that generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel were fruitful and increased abundantly and multiplied and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the sons of Israel are more and mightier than we.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, let us be wise concerning him, that he not multiply and it come to pass that when war comes, he shall also join with our enemies and fight against us and so leave the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. And they built the supply cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew, so much that they loathed the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians made the sons of Israel serve with rigor,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, making mortar and brick and in all manner of service in the field; all their service, in which they made them serve, was with rigor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and another named Puah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women and see the sex, if it is a son, then ye shall kill him; but if it is a daughter, then she shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the midwives feared God and did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them but gave the men children their lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing and have given the men children their lives?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women, for they are lively and are delivered before the midwives come in unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied and waxed very mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall give them their lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a man of the house of Levi went and took to wife a daughter of Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: who conceived and gave birth to a son, and seeing that he was beautiful, she hid him three months.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she could no longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes and daubed it with slime and with pitch and put the child in it, and she laid it in the reeds by the river’s brink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his sister stood afar off to see what would happen to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river, and walking with her maidens along by the river’s side, she saw the ark among the reeds; she sent her maid to bring it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she had opened it, she saw the child, and, behold, the babe wept. And having compassion on him, she said, This is one of the Hebrews’ children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his sister said unto Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women that she may nurse the child for thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child’s mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said unto her, Take this child away and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child and nursed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the child grew, she brought him unto Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses, for she said, Because I drew him out of the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in those days when Moses was grown, that he went out unto his brethren and looked on their burdens, and he spied an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no one, he slew the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he went out the next day, behold, two men of the Hebrews strove together, and he said to him that did the wrong, Why smitest thou thy fellow?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? Doest thou intend to kill me as thou killed the Egyptian? And Moses feared and said, Surely this thing is known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh and dwelt in the land of Midian; and he sat down by a well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters who came and drew water to fill the troughs to water their father’s sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the pastors came and drove them away. Then Moses stood up and defended them and watered their sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they returned unto Reuel, their father, he said, How is it that ye are come so soon today?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the pastors and also drew water enough for us and watered the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto his daughters, And where is he? Why is it that ye have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was content to dwell with the man; and he gave Moses Zipporah, his daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she gave birth to a son, and he called his name Gershon, for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in process of time that the king of Egypt died, and the sons of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God from their bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God heard their groaning and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God looked upon the sons of Israel, and God recognized them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Moses shepherded the sheep of Jethro, his father-in-law, the priest of Midian, he led the flock to the backside of the desert and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Angel of the LORD appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush; and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said, I will now turn aside and see this great vision, why the bush is not burnt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the LORD saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush and said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.
speaker: God

text: And he said, Do not come near; take off thy shoes from thy feet, for the place upon which thou dost stand is holy ground.
speaker: God

text: Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses covered his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.
speaker: God

text: And the LORD said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their sorrows;
speaker: God

text: and I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that land unto a good and broad land, unto a land flowing with milk and honey, unto the places of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.
speaker: God

text: Therefore, behold, the cry of the sons of Israel has now come before me, and I have also seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.
speaker: God

text: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh that thou may bring forth my people, the sons of Israel, out of Egypt.
speaker: God

text: Then Moses said unto God, Who am I that I should go unto Pharaoh and that I should bring forth the sons of Israel out of Egypt?
speaker: God

text: And he said, Certainly I will be with thee; and this shall be a token unto thee that I have sent thee: When thou hast brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
speaker: God

text: And Moses said unto God, Behold, when I come unto the sons of Israel and say unto them, The God of your fathers has sent me unto you, and if they say to me, What is his name? What shall I say unto them?
speaker: God

text: And God answered unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM. And he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the sons of Israel: I AM (YHWH) has sent me unto you.
speaker: God

text: And God said moreover unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the sons of Israel: The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me unto you. This is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all ages.
speaker: God

text: Go and gather the elders of Israel together and say unto them, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you and seen that which is done to you in Egypt,
speaker: God

text: and I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite unto a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: God

text: And they shall hearken to thy voice, and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews has found us; therefore, we shall now go three days’ journey into the wilderness that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
speaker: God

text: For I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go except by a mighty hand.
speaker: God

text: But I will stretch out my hand and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof, and after that he will let you go.
speaker: God

text: And I will give this people grace in the eyes of the Egyptians, and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty;
speaker: God

text: but every woman shall demand of her neighbour and of her that sojourns in her house, vessels of silver and vessels of gold and clothing; and ye shall put them upon your sons and upon your daughters, and ye shall spoil Egypt.
speaker: God

text: Then Moses answered and said, But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice, for they will say, The LORD has not appeared unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto him, What is that in thy hand? And he said, A rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Cast it on the ground. And he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent, and Moses fled from before it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Put forth thy hand, and take it by the tail. And he put forth his hand and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they will believe that the LORD God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has appeared unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said furthermore unto him, Now put thy hand into thy bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom, and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous as snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Put thy hand into thy bosom again. And he put his hand into his bosom again and plucked it out of his bosom, and, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river and pour it upon the dry land; and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto the LORD, O my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither up until now, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy slave; but I am slow of speech and of a slow tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto him, Who has made man’s mouth? Or who makes the dumb or the deaf or the seeing or the blind? Am not I the LORD?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore go and I will be with thy mouth and teach thee what thou shalt say.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, O my Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the anger of the LORD was kindled against Moses, and he said, Do I not know thy brother Aaron, the Levite, and that he can speak well? And also, behold, he comes forth to meet thee, and when he sees thee, he will be glad in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt speak unto him and put words in his mouth; and I will be with thy mouth and with his mouth and will teach you what ye shall do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall be thy spokesman unto the people; and he shall be unto thee as thy mouth, and thou shalt be unto him as God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take this rod in thy hand with which thou shalt do the signs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Moses went and returned unto Jethro, his father-in-law, and said unto him, I shall go now and return unto my brethren who are in Egypt and see whether they are yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD also said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt, for all the men are dead who sought thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses took his wife and his sons and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, When thou goest to return into Egypt, see that thou do all those wonders before Pharaoh, which I have put in thine hand; but I will harden his heart, that he shall not let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt say unto Pharaoh, The LORD hath said thus: Israel is my son, even my firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have said unto thee, Let my son go that he may serve me, but thou hast refused to let him go; therefore, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the LORD met him and sought to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Zipporah took a sharp flint and cut off the foreskin of her son and cast it at his feet, saying, Surely a bloody husband art thou to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went and met him in the mount of God and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD who had sent him and all the signs which he had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the sons of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron spoke all the words which the LORD had spoken unto Moses and did the signs before the eyes of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people believed; and hearing that the LORD had visited the sons of Israel and that he had seen their affliction, they bowed and worshipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward Moses and Aaron went in and told Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Let my people go that they may celebrate a feast unto me in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said, Who is the LORD, that I should hearken to his voice to let Israel go? I do not know the LORD, neither will I let Israel go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, The God of the Hebrews has found us; therefore we shall go three days’ journey into the desert and sacrifice unto the LORD our God lest he encounter us with pestilence or with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Egypt said unto them, Why do ye, Moses and Aaron, keep the people from their works? Go unto your burdens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh also said, Behold, the people of the land now are many, and ye make them cease from their burdens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people and their officers, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall no longer give the people firewood to make brick as until now; let them go and gather firewood for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the tally of the bricks which they made before, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish any of it; for they are idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let more work be laid upon them that they may occupy themselves with it; and let them not regard words of deception.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spoke to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you firewood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go ye, gather firewood where ye can find it; yet none of your work shall be diminished.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather brush for firewood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the taskmasters hasted them, saying, Fulfil your works, your daily quotas, as when there was firewood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the officers of the sons of Israel, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and they demanded, Why have ye not fulfilled your quotas in making brick both yesterday and today, as until now?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers of the sons of Israel came and cried unto Pharaoh, saying, Why doest thou deal thus with thy slaves?
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no firewood given unto thy slaves, yet they say to us, Make brick. Behold, thy slaves are beaten; and thy people sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he replied, Ye are idle, ye are idle, therefore ye say, Let us go and sacrifice unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go therefore now and work, for no firewood shall be given you, yet ye shall deliver the tally of bricks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers of the sons of Israel saw that they were afflicted after it was said, Ye shall not diminish any from the bricks of your daily quota.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said unto them, The LORD look upon you and judge because ye have made our savour to be a stench before Pharaoh and his slaves, putting a sword in their hands to slay us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses returned unto the LORD and said, Lord, why hast thou so afflicted this people? Why is it that thou hast sent me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he has afflicted this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Now thou shalt see what I will do to Pharaoh; for with a strong hand he must let them go, and with a strong hand he shall drive them out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God spoke unto Moses and said unto him, I am the LORD;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, as God Almighty, but by my name the LORD (YHWH) I was not known to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, in which they were strangers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise I have heard the groaning of the sons of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say unto the sons of Israel, I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will free you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched out arm and with great judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will take you as my people, and I will be your God: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, who brought you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring you in unto the land, concerning which I raised my hand to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it unto you for a heritage: I am the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this manner Moses spoke unto the sons of Israel, but they did not hearken unto Moses because of their anguish of spirit and cruel bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go in, speak unto Pharaoh, king of Egypt, that he let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses answered before the LORD, saying, Behold, the sons of Israel do not hearken unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, seeing I am of uncircumcised lips?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron and gave them a commandment unto the sons of Israel and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the heads of their fathers’ families: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi; these are the families of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Saul the son of a Canaanite woman; these are the families of Simeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their lineages: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. And the years of the life of Levi were one hundred thirty-seven years.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gershon: Libni, and Shimi, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were one hundred thirty-three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Merari: Mahali and Mushi; these are the families of Levi according to their lineages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Amram took Jochebed, his father’s sister to wife; and she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were one hundred thirty-seven years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Zithri.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron took Elizabeth, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Naashon, to wife; and she bore him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korhites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eleazar, Aaron’s son, took one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers of the Levites according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the LORD said, Bring out the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who spoke to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to bring out the sons of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the day when the LORD spoke unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying, I am the LORD; speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said before the LORD, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD said unto Moses, See, I have constituted thee as god unto Pharaoh; and Aaron, thy brother, shall be thy prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt speak all that I shall command thee; and Aaron, thy brother, shall speak unto Pharaoh that he send the sons of Israel out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, but I shall lay my hand upon Egypt and bring forth my hosts, and my people, the sons of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD when I stretch forth my hand upon Egypt and bring out the sons of Israel from among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron did as the LORD commanded them, so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was eighty years old and Aaron eighty-three years old when they spoke unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: If Pharaoh shall answer you, saying, Show a miracle, then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod and cast it before Pharaoh, that it shall become a dragon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did as the LORD had commanded; and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his slaves, and it became a dragon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh also called wise men and sorcerers; now the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their fire worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: For each one cast down his rod, and they became dragons; but Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh’s heart became hard, that he hearkened not unto them as the LORD had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart is become grievous, for he refuses to let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go unto Pharaoh in the morning; behold, he goes out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river’s brink before him and take in thy hand the rod which was turned to a serpent
speaker: Narrator

text: and say unto him, The LORD, the God of the Hebrews has sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness; and, behold, until now thou hast not desired to hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said, In this thou shalt know that I am the LORD; behold, I will smite with the rod that is in my hand the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fish that are in the river shall die, and the river shall stink; and the Egyptians shall loathe to drink the water of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod and stretch out thine hand upon the waters of Egypt, upon their rivers, upon their streams, and upon their ponds, and upon all their pools of water, that they may become blood and that there may be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron did so, as the LORD commanded; and lifting up the rod, he smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his slaves; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fish that were in the river died; and the river became corrupted, so that the Egyptians could not drink the water of the river; and there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the magicians of Egypt did the same with their enchantments; and Pharaoh’s heart hardened itself, and he did not hearken unto them, as the LORD had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh turned and returned to his house, and even with all this he did not take this to heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in all Egypt they dug wells round about the river for water to drink, for they could not drink of the water of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seven days were fulfilled after the LORD had smitten the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD spoke unto Moses, Go unto Pharaoh and say unto him, The LORD hath said thus, Let my people go that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into thy house and into thy bedchamber and upon thy bed and into the houses of thy slaves and upon thy people and into thine ovens and into thy kneadingtroughs;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the frogs shall come up upon thee and upon thy people and upon all thy slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch forth thine hand with thy rod over the rivers, over the streams, and over the ponds and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the magicians did the same with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron and said unto them, Intreat the LORD that he may take away the frogs from me and from my people, and I will let the people go that they may sacrifice unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Tell me: when shall I intreat for thee and for thy slaves and for thy people, to destroy the frogs from thee and thy houses, that they may remain only in the river?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Tomorrow. And Moses replied, Be it according to thy word, that thou may know that there is none like unto the LORD our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the frogs shall depart from thee and from thy houses and from thy slaves and from thy people; they shall remain only in the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh; and Moses cried unto the LORD because of the frogs which he had brought against Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs of the houses, of the villages, and of the fields died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gathered them together in heaps; and the land was corrupted.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart and did not hearken unto them as the LORD had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod and smite the dust of the land, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did so; for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod and smote the dust of the earth, and it became lice in man and in beast; all the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the magicians did the same with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not. And there were lice upon man and upon beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God. But Pharaoh’s heart hardened, and he did not hearken unto them as the LORD had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh; behold, he goes forth to the water and say unto him, The LORD hath said thus, Let my people go that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee and upon thy slaves and upon thy people and into thy houses; and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of all kinds of flies and also the ground upon which they are.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will separate in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no kind of flies shall be there to the end that thou may know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will put redemption between my people and thy people. Tomorrow shall this sign be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD did so: that there came a grievous swarm of flies into the house of Pharaoh and into his slaves’ houses and into all the land of Egypt; and the land was corrupted by reason of the swarm of flies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses replied, It is not convenient to do so; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God. Behold, if we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, will they not stone us?
speaker: Narrator

text: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness and sacrifice to the LORD our God as he has said unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away; pray for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses answered, Behold, as I go out from thy presence, I will intreat the LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his slaves, and from his people tomorrow; if Pharaoh will not deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went out from Pharaoh, and prayed unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses, and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his slaves, and from his people; there remained not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh even hardened his heart this time and did not let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh and tell him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if thou refuse to let them go and wilt hold them still,
speaker: Narrator

text: behold, the hand of the LORD is upon thy livestock which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the cows, and upon the sheep: there shall be a very grievous pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall separate between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt so that nothing shall die of all that is of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD appointed a set time, saying, Tomorrow the LORD shall do this thing in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the next day the LORD did that thing, and of all the livestock of Egypt many died, but of the livestock of the sons of Israel not one died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not one of the livestock of the sons of Israel dead. But the heart of Pharaoh hardened, and he did not let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Let each of you take handfuls of soot from the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall become dust upon all the land of Egypt, which shall cause boils breaking forth with blisters upon man and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took the soot of the furnace and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and boils breaking forth with blisters came upon man and upon beast
speaker: Narrator

text: until the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boils were upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he did not hearken unto them as the LORD had spoken unto Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For otherwise this time I will send all my plagues upon thine heart and upon thy slaves and upon thy people that thou may know that there is none like me in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now I will stretch out my hand that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence, and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in truth I have placed thee to declare my power in thee, and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou even so dost exalt thyself against my people that thou wilt not let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as has not been in Egypt since the foundation thereof even until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send therefore now and gather thy livestock and all that thou hast in the field; for upon every man and beast which shall be found in the field and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that feared the word of the LORD among the slaves of Pharaoh made his slaves and his livestock flee into the houses;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he that did not regard the word of the LORD left his slaves and his livestock in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon the men and upon the beasts and upon all the grass of the field throughout the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven, and the LORD raised his voice and it hailed, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the LORD rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was hail and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became inhabited.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both men and beasts; and the hail smote all the grass of the field and broke all the trees of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only in the land of Goshen, where the sons of Israel were, was there no hail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron and said unto them, I have sinned this time; the LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Intreat the LORD that the thunderings of God and the hail might cease; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay here no longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses replied unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will extend my hands unto the LORD; and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou may know how that the earth is the LORD’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I know thee and thy slaves from before ye began to fear the presence of the LORD God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The flax, therefore, and the barley were smitten, for the barley was headed out, and the flax was in stalk.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wheat and the rye were not smitten; for they were late.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses went out from the presence of Pharaoh and out of the city and extended his hands unto the LORD; and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he persevered in his sin and hardened his heart, he and his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heart of Pharaoh hardened, and he did not let the sons of Israel go as the LORD had spoken by Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh for I have hardened his heart and the heart of his slaves that I might show these my signs among them
speaker: Narrator

text: and that thou may tell in the ears of thy sons and of thy son’s sons the things I did in Egypt and my signs which I gave among them and that ye may know that I am the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron came in unto Pharaoh and said unto him, Thus hath the LORD God of the Hebrews said, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? Let my people go that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring the locusts into thy borders,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall cover the face of the earth that one will not be able to see the earth, and they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remains unto you from the hail and shall eat every tree which produces fruit for you out of the field:
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall fill thy houses and the houses of all thy slaves and the houses of all the Egyptians, which neither thy fathers, nor thy fathers’ fathers have seen since the day that they were upon the earth unto this day. And he turned himself and went out from Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh’s slaves said unto him, How long shall this man be a snare unto us? Let the men go that they may serve the LORD their God; knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh; and he said unto them, Go, serve the LORD your God. Who are those that shall go?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses replied, We must go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our sheep and with our cows we must go; for we have a solemn feast unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Even if the LORD be with you, how can I let you go with your little ones; look at the malice which is before your face.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be so: go now ye that are men and serve the LORD; for that is what ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the land of Egypt to bring the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt and eat all the grass of the land and all that the hail has left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all that night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt and landed in all the borders of Egypt. Very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall there be such.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they ate all the grass of the land and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left; and there did not remain any green thing in the trees or in the grass of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said, I have sinned against the LORD your God and against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and intreat the LORD your God, that he may take away from me this death only.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out from Pharaoh and intreated the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD turned a mighty strong west wind, which took away the locusts and cast them into the Red Sea; there remained not one locust in all the borders of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, so that he would not let the sons of Israel go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven, and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not see one another, neither did any rise from his place for three days; but all the sons of Israel had light in their dwellings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called unto Moses and said, Go, serve the LORD; only let your sheep and your cows remain; let your little ones also go with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses replied, Thou also must give us sacrifices and burnt offerings that we may sacrifice unto the LORD our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our cattle shall also go with us; not a hoof shall be left behind; for we must take thereof to serve the LORD our God; and we do not know with what we must serve the LORD until we arrive there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto him, Go from me, take heed to thyself to see my face no more; for in the day that thou seest my face thou shalt die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses replied, Thou hast spoken well, I will not see thy face again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, I will bring one more plague upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt, after which he will let you go from here; when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out of here altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak now to the people and let each man demand of his neighbour and each woman of her neighbour, vessels of silver and of gold.

text: And the LORD gave the people grace in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s slaves, and in the sight of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, The LORD hath said thus, About midnight I will go out into the midst of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sits upon his throne even unto the firstborn of the maidservant that is behind the mill and all the firstborn of beasts.

text: And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there has never been one like it, nor shall there ever be any like it again.
speaker: Narrator

text: But among all the sons of Israel, from man to beast, not a dog shall move his tongue, that ye may know that the LORD shall make a difference between the Egyptians and the Israelites.

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: but the LORD had hardened Pharaoh’s heart, so that he would not let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: This month shall be unto you the beginning of the months; it shall be the first month of the year to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak unto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month let each man take a lamb according to the families of the fathers, a lamb per family;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if the household is too small and is not able to eat the lamb, let him and his neighbour next unto his house take it according to the number of persons; each one according to his eating shall make your count for the lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lamb shall be without blemish, a male of one year; ye shall take it out from the sheep or from the goats;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye shall keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month, and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it between the two evenings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall take of the blood and put it on the two side posts and on the upper door post of the houses in which they shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roasted with fire, and unleavened bread; and with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eat none of it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roast with fire, his head with his legs, and with the entrails thereof.

text: And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; and that which remains of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus shall ye eat it: with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is the LORD’s passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will pass through the land of Egypt this night and will smite all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both among man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments: I am the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread, for in this same day have I brought your hosts out of the land of Egypt; therefore, shall ye observe this day for your ages by an ordinance forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall eat nothing leavened; in all your habitations ye shall eat unleavened bread.

text: For the LORD will pass through smiting the Egyptians, and when he sees the blood upon the lintel and on the two side posts, the LORD will pass over that door and will not allow the destroyer to come in unto your houses to smite you.

text: And the sons of Israel went away, and as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, that at midnight the LORD smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sat on his throne unto the firstborn of the captive that was in the dungeon, and all the firstborn of the animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his slaves and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called for Moses and Aaron by night and said, Rise up, and get you forth from among my people, both ye and the sons of Israel, and go, serve the LORD as ye have said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also take your sheep and your cows, as ye have said, and be gone; and bless me also.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneadingtroughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked the Egyptians for vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD gave the people grace in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they gave unto them such things as they required. And they spoiled the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And a mixed multitude went up also with them and many sheep and cows.

text: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened because they were thrust out of Egypt and could not tarry nor prepare food for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: It is a night to be much observed unto the LORD for bringing them out from the land of Egypt: this night should be observed unto the LORD by all the sons of Israel in their ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses and Aaron, This shall be the ordinance of the passover: No stranger shall eat of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: but every man’s slave that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foreigner and the hired servant shall not eat of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be eaten in one house; thou shalt not carry forth any of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the congregation of Israel shall make this sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a stranger shall sojourn with thee and desire to make the passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and make this sacrifice; and he shall be as one that is natural in the land, but no uncircumcised person shall eat of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same law shall be for the one who is natural, and for the stranger that sojourns among you.

text: Thus did all the sons of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that same day that the LORD did bring the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of slavery; for the LORD has brought you out of here with a strong hand; therefore, ye shall not eat with leaven.

text: This day ye came out in the month Abib.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the LORD shall have brought thee into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, which he swore unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shalt do this service in this month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat without leaven for seven days, and the seventh day shall be a feast unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bread without leaven shall be eaten the seven days; and nothing leavened shall be seen with thee, neither shall there be any leaven in all thy borders.

text: and it came to pass when Pharaoh was hardening himself to not let us go that the LORD slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt from the human firstborn to the firstborn of the beast; therefore, I sacrifice to the LORD every male that opens the womb, and I ransom every firstborn of my sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be for a token upon thy hand, and for a memorial before thine eyes: That the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a strong hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when Pharaoh had let the people go that God did not lead them through the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: but God led the people round about through the way of the wilderness of the Red Sea. And the sons of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses also took the bones of Joseph with him, who had made the sons of Israel swear, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away from here with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took their journey from Succoth and encamped in Etham in the edge of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of cloud to lead them in the way and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light that they might walk by day and by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: He never took away the pillar of cloud by day nor the pillar of fire by night from before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak unto the sons of Israel that they turn and set up their camp before Pihahiroth between Migdol and the sea over against Baalzephon; before it shall ye set up camp by the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Pharaoh will say of the sons of Israel, They are entangled in the land; the wilderness has shut them in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart that he shall follow after them; and I will be glorified in Pharaoh and in all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD. And they did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told the king of Egypt how the people fled; and the heart of Pharaoh and of his slaves was turned against the people, and they said, Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ready his chariot and took his people with him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he took six hundred chosen chariots and all the chariots of Egypt and the captains over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and he pursued after the sons of Israel, but the sons of Israel had already left with great power.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Egyptians, nevertheless, pursued after them with all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, his horsemen, and all his army, and overtook them setting up camp by the sea beside Pihahiroth before Baalzephon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Pharaoh drew near, the sons of Israel lifted up their eyes, and, behold, the Egyptians marched after them; and they feared greatly, and the sons of Israel cried out unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why hast thou dealt thus with us, to bring us forth out of Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is this not what we told thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone that we may serve the Egyptians? For it would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than that we should die in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still and see the saving health of the LORD, which he will bestow on you today; for the Egyptians whom ye have seen today, ye shall never see them again for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall be still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Why criest thou unto me? Speak unto the sons of Israel that they go forward:
speaker: Narrator

text: And lift up thy rod and stretch out thy hand over the sea and divide it; and the sons of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians that they shall follow them: and I will be glorified in Pharaoh and in all his host, in his chariots, and in his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have glorified myself in Pharaoh, in his chariots, and in his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, removed and went behind them; and likewise the pillar of cloud went from before their face and stood behind them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel; and it was a cloud and darkness to them, but it lit up the night unto Israel; and all that night the one side never came near the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand and on their left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians pursued and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that in the morning watch the LORD looked at the camp of the Egyptians in the pillar of fire and of cloud and troubled the camp of the Egyptians
speaker: Narrator

text: and took off their chariot wheels and overturned them grievously, so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the LORD fights for them against the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the sea that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned in its strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and the LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots and the horsemen and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the sons of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand and on their left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the LORD saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel saw that great work which the LORD did against the Egyptians; and the people feared the LORD and believed the LORD and his slave Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and the sons of Israel sang this song unto the LORD and spoke, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he has triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider he has thrown into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is my strength and song, and he is become my saving health; he is my God, and I will prepare him a habitation; my father’s God, and I will exalt him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is a man of war; the LORD is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh’s chariots and his host he has cast into the sea; his chosen princes also are drowned in the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The depths have covered them; they sank into the bottom as a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy right hand, O LORD, is become glorious in power; thy right hand, O LORD, has dashed the enemy in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown those that rose up against thee; thou didst send forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered together, the floods stood upright as a heap, and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my soul shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them. They sank as lead in the mighty waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is like unto thee, O LORD, among the gods? Who is like thee, magnificent in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst stretch out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed; thou hast guided them in thy strength unto the habitation of thy holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The peoples shall hear and be afraid; sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling, shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear and dread shall fall upon them; by the greatness of thine arm they shall be as still as a stone, until thy people pass over, O LORD, until the people pass over, which thou hast purchased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt bring them in and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, in the place of thy dwelling which thou hast made ready, O LORD, in the Sanctuary of the Lord, which thy hands have established.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall reign for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Pharaoh went in on horseback with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the sons of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to the LORD, for he has triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider he has thrown into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses brought Israel from the Red Sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter; therefore the name of it was called Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cried unto the LORD; and the LORD showed him a tree, which when he had cast it into the waters, the waters were made sweet. There he gave them statutes and rights, and there he proved them
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God and wilt do that which is right in his sight and wilt give ear to his commandments and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians; for I am the LORD thy Healer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Elim, where there were twelve fountains of water and seventy palm trees; and they encamped there by the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the sons of Israel came unto the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole congregation of the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sons of Israel said unto them, It would have been better if we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh pots and when we ate bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness to kill this whole assembly with hunger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather the word for every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that on the sixth day they shall prepare that which they bring in, which shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron said unto all the sons of Israel, At evening ye shall know that the LORD has brought you out from the land of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning ye shall see the glory of the LORD; for he has heard your murmurings against the LORD; and what are we, that ye murmur against us?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, This shall be when the LORD shall give you in the evening flesh to eat and in the morning bread to the full; for the LORD has heard your murmurings which ye have murmured against him; and what are we? Your murmurings are not against us, but against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses spoke unto Aaron, Say unto all the congregation of the sons of Israel, Come near before the LORD, for he has heard your murmurings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as Aaron spoke unto the whole congregation of the sons of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and, behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have heard the murmurings of the sons of Israel; speak unto them, saying, Between the two evenings ye shall eat flesh, and tomorrow ye shall be filled with bread; and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, that in the evening quail came up, and covered the camp; and in the morning the dew descended round about the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the dew ceased to descend, behold, upon the face of the wilderness there lay a small round thing as small as the hoar frost on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sons of Israel saw it, they said one to another, It is manna (What is it?): for they did not know what it was. Then Moses said unto them, This is the bread which the LORD has given you to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the thing which the LORD has commanded, Gather of it every man according to his eating, an omer for each one, according to the number of your persons; take ye each one for those who are in his tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel did so and gathered, some more, some less.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they did measure it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack; they gathered each one according to his eating.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, Let no one leave of it until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding they did not hearken unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms and stank; and Moses was angry with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gathered it early in the morning, each one according to his eating; and when the sun waxed hot, it melted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one; and all the princes of the congregation came and told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, This is what the LORD has said, Tomorrow is the holy sabbath of rest unto the LORD; bake that which ye will bake today and cook what ye will cook; and that which remains over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid it up until the morning as Moses bade; and it did not stink, neither was there any worm in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, Eat that today; for today is a sabbath unto the LORD; today ye shall not find it in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day, which is the sabbath, in it there shall be none.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, and they found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments and my laws?
speaker: Narrator

text: See that the LORD has given you the sabbath; therefore, he gives you the bread of two days on the sixth day; abide ye every man in his place; let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people rested on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house of Israel called its name Manna; and it was like coriander seed, white, and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, This is what the LORD has commanded, Fill an omer of it to be kept for your descendants, that they may see the bread with which I have fed you in the wilderness when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a pot and put an omer full of manna in it and lay it up before the LORD, to be kept for your descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the sons of Israel ate manna forty years until they came to a land inhabited; they ate manna until they came unto the borders of the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the congregation of the sons of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, after their journeys, according to the commandment of the LORD, and set up camp in Rephidim; and there was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people chided with Moses and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why chide ye with me? Why do ye tempt the LORD?
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses and said, Why hast thou brought us up out of Egypt to kill us and our children and our livestock with thirst?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, What shall I do with this people? They are almost ready to stone me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go on before the people and take with thee of the elders of Israel and thy rod, with which thou didst smite the river take in thine hand and go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb, and thou shalt smite the rock, and water shall come out of it that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah because of the chiding of the sons of Israel and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Amalek came and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men and go out, fight with Amalek; tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him and fought with Amalek; and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; but when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses’ hands were heavy, so they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat upon it; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side and the other on the other side; thus his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua disabled Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in the book and tell Joshua that I must utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses built an altar and called the name of it The LORD is my Banner, {YHWH-nissi}
speaker: Narrator

text: for he said, Because Amalek lifted his hand against the throne of the LORD, the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done with Moses and with Israel his people and how the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her back,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her two sons, of which the name of the one was Gershon, for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the name of the other was Eliezer, for the God of my father, said he, helped me and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness, where he was camped next to the mount of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said unto Moses, I, thy father-in-law Jethro, am come unto thee and thy wife and her two sons with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law and did obeisance and kissed him; and they asked each other of their peace; and they came into the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses told his father-in-law all that the LORD had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake and all the travail that had come upon them in the way and how the LORD delivered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the LORD had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jethro said, Blessed be the LORD, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods; for in the thing in which they dealt proudly he prevailed against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took burnt offerings and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass another day that Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood before Moses from the morning unto the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this that thou doest to the people? Why sittest thou thyself alone and all the people stand before thee from morning unto evening?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto his father-in-law, Because the people come unto me to enquire of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I declare unto them the statutes of God and his laws.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses’ father-in-law said unto him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou and this people that is with thee; for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people before God that thou may submit the causes unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws and shalt show them the way in which they must walk and the work that they must do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover thou shalt consider out of all the people men of virtue, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness, and place princes over them, of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them judge the people at all seasons; and it shall be that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge, so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt do this thing and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law and did all that he had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses chose men of virtue out of all Israel and made them heads over the people, princes over thousands, over hundreds, over fifties, and over tens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they judged the people at all seasons; the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went to his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the third month from when the sons of Israel had gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they had departed from Rephidim and were come to the desert of Sinai and had pitched in the wilderness, and there Israel camped before the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses went up unto God, and the LORD called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob and tell the sons of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians and how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you unto myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, if ye will give ear to hearken unto my voice and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a special treasure unto me above all peoples; for all the earth is mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall be my kingdom of priests and a holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator
