text: Then Moses came and called for the elders of the people and laid before their faces all these words which the LORD commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people answered together and said, All that the LORD has spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Behold, I come unto thee in a thick cloud that the people may hear when I speak with thee and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go unto the people and sanctify them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their clothes
speaker: Narrator

text: and be ready for the third day; for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves that ye go not up into the mount or touch the border of it; whoever touches the mount shall surely die:
speaker: Narrator

text: Not a hand shall touch it, but that he shall surely be stoned or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not live. When the jubilee sounds long, they shall come up to the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses went down from the mount unto the people and sanctified the people, and they washed their clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day; come not at your women.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the third day when the morning came, that there were thunders and lightnings and a thick cloud upon the mount and the voice of the shofar {ram’s horn} exceeding loud, so that all the people that were in the camp trembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the lower part of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Mount Sinai smoked because the LORD had descended upon it in fire, and its smoke ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the voice of the shofar sounded long and waxed louder and louder; Moses spoke, and God answered him by a voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mount, and the LORD called Moses up to the top of the mount, and Moses went up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people lest they break through the bounds to gaze upon the LORD, and many of them perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also let the priests who come near to the LORD, sanctify themselves lest the LORD break forth upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto the LORD, The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai; for thou hast charged us, saying, Set bounds about the mount and sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto him, Away, get thee down, and thou shalt come up, thou and Aaron with thee, but let not the priests and the people break through the bounds to come up unto the LORD lest he break forth upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses went down unto the people and spoke unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God spoke all these words, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the LORD thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt out of the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image or any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above or that is in the earth beneath nor that is in the water under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not bow down to them nor serve them; for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons unto the third and fourth generation of those that hate me
speaker: Narrator

text: and showing mercy unto thousands of generations of those that love me and keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain for the LORD will not hold guiltless anyone that takes his name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt remember the sabbath day, to sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shalt thou labour and do all thy work;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the seventh day shall be the sabbath of the LORD thy God; in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manslave, nor thy maidslave, nor thy beast, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates;
speaker: Narrator

text: for in six days the LORD made the heavens and earth, the sea, and all that is in them and rested the seventh day; therefore, the LORD blessed the sabbath day and sanctified it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour thy father and thy mother that thy days may be lengthened upon the land which the LORD thy God gives thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not give false testimony against thy neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s wife, nor his manslave, nor his maidslave, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people saw the thunderings and the lightnings and the noise of the trumpet and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they trembled and stood afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us, and we will hear; but let not God speak with us lest we die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto the people, Fear not, for God is come to prove you and that his fear may be before your faces, that ye sin not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God was.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the sons of Israel, Ye have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not make with me gods of silver, neither shall ye make unto you gods of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt offerings and thy peace offerings, thy sheep and thine oxen; in whatever place where I cause my name to be remembered, I will come unto thee, and I will bless thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stone; for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou go up by steps unto my altar that thy nakedness not be discovered thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the rights which thou shalt set before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou should buy a Hebrew slave, he shall serve six years; and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself; if he was married, then his wife shall go out with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his master has given him a wife, and she has born him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master’s, and he shall go out by himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the slave shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his master shall bring him unto the judges; he shall also bring him to the door or unto the door post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an aul; and he shall serve him forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man should sell his daughter to be a maidslave, she shall not go out as the menslaves do.
speaker: Narrator

text: If she pleases not her master, who therefore took her not unto himself to wife, then it is permitted that she be ransomed; and he may not sell her unto a strange nation when he rejects her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he has betrothed her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he takes another wife, her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, he shall not diminish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he does not do these three things unto her, then shall she go out free without money.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that smites a man so that he dies shall be surely put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man did not lie in wait but God delivered him into his hand, then I will appoint thee a place where he shall flee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a man comes presumptuously upon his neighbour to slay him with prudence, thou shalt take him from my altar that he may die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that smites his father or his mother shall be surely put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he that steals a man and sells him, or if he is found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner he that curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if men strive together and one smites another with a stone or with his fist and he dies not, but keeps his bed,
speaker: Narrator

text: if he rises again and walks abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be absolved, only he shall pay for the loss of his time and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man smites his slave or his maid with a rod and he dies under his hand, he shall be surely punished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, if he continues a day or two, he shall not be punished, for he is his money.
speaker: Narrator

text: If men strive and hurt a woman with child so that she aborts but without death, he shall be surely punished according as the woman’s husband will lay upon him, and he shall pay by the judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if there is death, then thou shalt pay life for life,
speaker: Narrator

text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
speaker: Narrator

text: burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if someone smites the eye of their slave or the eye of their maid that it perishes, he shall let them go free for their eye’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he smites out his manslave’s tooth or his maidslave’s tooth, he shall let them go free for their tooth’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: If an ox gores a man or a woman that they die, then the ox shall surely be stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be absolved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the ox were wont to push with his horn in time past and it has been testified to his owner, and he has not kept him in, but that he has killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is laid on him a sum of money, then he shall give for the ransom of his life whatever is laid upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether it has gored a son or has gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the ox shall gore a manslave or a maidslave, he shall give unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if someone shall open a pit or if someone shall dig a pit and not cover it and an ox or an ass falls in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: the owner of the pit shall make it good and give money unto their owner, and the dead beast shall be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if one man’s ox hurts another’s that he dies; then they shall sell the live ox and divide the money of it, and the dead ox they shall also divide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if it is known that the ox used to push in time past and his owner has not kept him in, he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead shall be his own.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man shall steal an ox or a sheep and kill it or sell it he shall restore five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a thief is found breaking into a house and is smitten so he dies, he that killed him shall not be guilty of his blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the sun is risen upon him, he that killed him is guilty of his blood; the thief should make full restitution; if he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he is found with the theft in his hand, whether it be ox or ass or sheep, he shall restore double.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten and shall put in his beast and shall feed in another man’s field; of the best of his own field and of the best of his own vineyard shall he make restitution.
speaker: Narrator

text: When fires are lit and in burning the thorns burn also the stacks of sheaves or the standing grain, or the field is consumed; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it is stolen out of the man’s house; if the thief is found, let him pay double.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the thief is not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges to see whether he has put his hand unto his neighbour’s goods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all manner of fraud, whether it be for an ox, for an ass, for a sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challenges to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man delivers unto his neighbour an ass or an ox or a sheep or any beast to keep, and it dies or is hurt or driven away, no man seeing it,
speaker: Narrator

text: then shall an oath of the LORD be between them both, that he has not put his hand unto his neighbour’s goods, and the owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto its owner.
speaker: Narrator

text: If it is torn in pieces, then let him bring witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if anyone borrows anything of his neighbour, and it is hurt or dies, its owner not being with it, he shall surely make it good.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if its owner is with it, he shall not make it good; if it was hired, it came for its hire.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man should entice a virgin that is not betrothed and lie with her, he shall surely endow her and take her to be his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: If her father utterly refuses to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever lies with a beast shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that sacrifices unto any god, except unto the LORD only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt neither mistreat a stranger nor oppress him; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not afflict any widow or fatherless child.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou afflict them in any manner, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
speaker: Narrator

text: and my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou should lend money to my people, to the poor who is with thee, thou shalt not be to him as a usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou at all take thy neighbour’s clothing as a pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him before the sun goes down;
speaker: Narrator

text: for only that is his covering, it is his clothing to cover his flesh, in which he must sleep; and it shall come to pass, when he cries unto me, that I will hear, for I am merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not revile the judges nor curse the prince of thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits and of thy liquors; the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen and with thy sheep; seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall be holy men unto me; neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not admit a false rumour; put not thine hand with the wicked to be a false witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause hiding behind many to wrest judgment;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither shalt thou honour a poor man in his cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou should encounter thine enemy’s ox or his ass astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou see the ass of him that hates thee lying under his burden, will thou forbear to help him? Thou shalt surely help him to raise it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not pervert the rights of thy poor in his cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thee far from a false matter; and slay thou not the innocent and righteous; for I will not justify the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take no bribe; for the bribe blinds the wise and perverts the words of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger, for ye know the state of the soul of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And six years thou shalt sow thy land and shalt gather in its increase,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the seventh year thou shalt leave it free and release it, that the poor of thy people may eat, and what they leave the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard and with thy oliveyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest, that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy handmaid and the stranger may be refreshed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in all things that I have said unto you, be circumspect and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times thou shalt celebrate a feast unto me in the year:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days as I commanded thee, in the time appointed of the month Abib, for in it thou didst come out from Egypt; and none shall appear before me empty),
speaker: Narrator

text: And the feast of the harvest of the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou hast sown in the field, and the feast of ingathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord GOD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my lamb remain until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid in his mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I send the Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself before him and hear his voice, grieve him not; for he will not pardon your rebellion, for my name is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou shalt indeed hear his voice and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies and an adversary unto those that afflict thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my Angel shall go before thee and bring thee in unto the land of the Amorite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Canaanite the Hivite and the Jebusite; and I will cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works; but thou shalt utterly overthrow them and completely break down their images.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall serve the LORD your God, and he shall bless thy bread and thy water; and I will take all sickness away from the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: No women shall abort, nor be barren, in thy land; the number of thy days I will fulfil.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send my fear before thee and will trouble all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not drive them out from before thee in one year lest the land become desolate and the beasts of the field multiply against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little by little I will drive them out from before thee until thou be multiplied and take the land by inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set thy borders from the Red Sea even unto the sea of the Philistines and from the desert unto the river; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not dwell in thy land lest peradventure they make thee sin against me by serving their gods, for it will be a snare unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto the LORD, thou and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu and seventy of the elders of Israel, and worship afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses alone shall approach the LORD, but they shall not come near; neither shall the people go up with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD and all the rights, and all the people answered with one voice and said, All the words which the LORD has said we will do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD and rose up early in the morning and built an altar at the foot of the mount and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent the young men of the sons of Israel, who had offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of bullocks unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took the book of the covenant and read in the audience of the people, and they said, All that the LORD has said we will do, and we will hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses took the blood and sprinkled it on the people and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the LORD has made with you concerning all these words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu and seventy of the elders of Israel went up,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they saw the God of Israel; and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone like unto the heaven when it is clear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not lay his hand upon the princes of the sons of Israel, and they saw God and ate and drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount and wait there, and I will give thee tables of stone and the law and commandments which I have written to teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua, and Moses went up into the mount of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto the elders, wait here for us until we come again unto you; and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you; if anyone has any matters to settle, let him come unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went up into the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the glory of the LORD abode upon Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days, and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud and went up into the mount, and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak unto the sons of Israel that they bring me an offering; of every man that gives it willingly with his heart ye shall take my offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be the offering which ye shall take of them: gold and silver and brass
speaker: Narrator

text: and blue and purple and scarlet and fine linen and goats’ hair
speaker: Narrator

text: and rams’ skins dyed red and badgers’ skins and cedar wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: onyx stones and stones to be set in the ephod and in the pectoral.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all that I show thee, after the pattern of the tabernacle and the pattern of all its vessels, even so shall ye make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall make an ark of cedar wood; two cubits and a half shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cover it with pure gold; within and without shalt thou cover it and shalt make upon it a moulding of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it and put them in the four corners thereof, and two rings shall be in the one side of it and two rings in the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make staves of cedar wood and overlay them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, that the ark may be borne with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The staves shall be in the rings of the ark; they shall not be taken from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make a seat of reconciliation of pure gold; two cubits and a half shall be its length and a cubit and a half its breadth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make two cherubim of gold; of beaten work shalt thou make them, in the two ends of the seat of reconciliation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And make one cherub on the one end and the other cherub on the other end: even of the seat of reconciliation shall ye make the cherubim on the two ends thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cherubim shall stretch forth their wings on high, covering the seat of reconciliation with their wings, and their faces shall look one to another; toward the seat of reconciliation shall the faces of the cherubim be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the seat of reconciliation above upon the ark, and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there I will meet with thee, and I will speak with thee from above the seat of reconciliation, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment unto the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt likewise make a table of cedar wood; two cubits shall be its length and a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cover it with pure gold and make a moulding of gold round about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make unto it a border of a handbreadth round about, and thou shalt make a golden moulding to its border round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make for it four rings of gold and put the rings in the four corners that are on the four feet thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over against the border shall the rings be for places of the staves to bear the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the staves of cedar wood and cover them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the dishes thereof and spoons thereof and covers thereof and bowls thereof to cover the bread; of pure gold shalt thou make them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the showbread upon the table before me always.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make a lampstand of pure gold; of beaten work shall the lampstand be made; its base and its branches, its bowls, its knops, and its flowers shall be of the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: And six branches shall come out of the sides of it, three branches of the lampstand out of the one side and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side,
speaker: Narrator

text: three bowls made like unto almonds with a knop and a flower in one branch, and three bowls made like almonds in the other branch with a knop and a flower; thus in the six branches that come out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the lampstand shall be four bowls made like unto almonds with their knops and their flowers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be a knop under two branches of the same, and another knop under two branches of the same, and another knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches that proceed out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their knops and their branches shall be of the same; all of it shall be one beaten work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make its seven lamps; and they shall light its lamps, that they may give light over against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And its tongs, and its snuffdishes, shall be of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a talent of pure gold shall he make it, with all these vessels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And look that thou make them after their pattern, which was showed thee in the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet; with cherubim of cunning work shalt thou make them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits; and all the curtains shall have one measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: The five curtains shall be coupled together one to another, and the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the border in the coupling; and likewise shalt thou make in the uttermost edge of another curtain in the coupling of the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fifty loops shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make in the border of the curtain that is in the second coupling; that the loops may take hold one of another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make fifty hooks of gold and couple the curtains together with the hooks; and it shall be one tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise thou shalt make curtains of goats’ hair to be a covering over the tabernacle; eleven curtains shalt thou make.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits; and the eleven curtains shall be all of one measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shalt double the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain from the border in the coupling and fifty loops in the edge of the curtain which couples the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make fifty hooks of brass and put the hooks into the loops and couple the tent together that it may be one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the remnant that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the backside of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a cubit on the one side and a cubit on the other side of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent, it shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red and a covering above of badgers’ skins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle of cedar wood standing up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half shall be the breadth of one board.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two tenons shall there be in one board, set in order one against another; thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards on the side of the Negev to the south.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards, two sockets under one board for its two tenons and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the second side of the tabernacle on the side of the Aquilon, {of the north wind} there shall be twenty boards
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board and two sockets under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward, thou shalt make six boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And two boards shalt thou make for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall be coupled together beneath, and they shall be coupled together above the head of it unto one ring; thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets: two sockets under one board and two sockets under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make five bars of cedar wood for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the two sides westward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall reach from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cover the boards with gold and make their rings of gold for places for the bars, and thou shalt also cover the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt raise up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was showed thee in the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt also make a veil of blue, purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen of cunning work; with cherubim shall it be made;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of cedar covered with gold; their capitals shall be of gold upon four sockets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt hang up the veil under the hooks, and thou shalt bring in there, inside the veil, the ark of the testimony; and that veil shall separate for you between the holy place and the holy of holies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the seat of reconciliation upon the ark of the testimony in the holy of holies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the table outside the veil, the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the Negev (south desert), and thou shalt put the table on the side of the Aquilon (north wind).
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make a hanging for the door of the tabernacle of blue, purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen wrought with needlework.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make for the hanging five pillars of cedar and cover them with gold, and their capitals shall be of gold, and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make an altar of cedar wood, five cubits long and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare, and its height shall be three cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the horns of it upon its four corners; its horns shall be of the same, and thou shalt cover it with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make its pans to receive the ashes with its burnt fat, and its shovels and its basins and its fleshhooks and its firepans; all the vessels thereof thou shalt make of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put it under the circumference of the altar beneath, that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make staves for the altar, staves of cedar wood, and cover them with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the staves shall be put into the rings, and the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar to bear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hollow with boards shalt thou make it; as it was showed thee in the mount, so shall they make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle; to the side of the Negev to the south there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen of one hundred cubits long for each side;
speaker: Narrator

text: and its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets shall be of brass; the capitals of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise for the side of the Aquilon in length there shall be hangings of one hundred cubits long, and its twenty pillars with their twenty sockets of brass, the capitals of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the breadth of the court on the side of the rising sun to the east shall be fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings of one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the gate of the court there shall be a hanging of twenty cubits of blue and purple and scarlet and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework; and their pillars shall be four and their sockets four.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the pillars round about the court shall be filleted with silver; their capitals shall be of silver, and their sockets of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits and the breadth fifty on the one side and fifty on the other and the height five cubits, its hangings of fine twined linen and their sockets of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the vessels of the tabernacle in all the service thereof and all the stakes thereof and all the stakes of the court, shall be of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt command the sons of Israel that they bring thee olive oil, clear, crushed, for the light, to cause the lamps to burn always.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the tabernacle of the testimony outside the veil, which shall be before the ark of the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order them from evening to morning before the LORD; it shall be a perpetual statute of the sons of Israel for their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And cause Aaron, thy brother, to come unto thee with his sons, from among the sons of Israel, that they may be my priests, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron, thy brother, for honour and for beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt speak unto all that are wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the Spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron’s garments to sanctify him, that he may be my priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the garments which they shall make: the pectoral, the ephod, the robe, the broidered coat, the mitre, and the girdle. Therefore let them make the holy garments for Aaron, thy brother, and his sons, that they may be my priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall take gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall make the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cunning work.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall have its two shoulderpieces joined at the two edges thereof, and so it shall be joined together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the special girdle of the ephod, which shall be over it, shall be of its same workmanship, of the same materials: of gold, blue, purple, scarlet and fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Six of their names on one stone and the other six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a seal, shalt thou engrave those two stones with the names of the sons of Israel; thou shalt make them to be set in settings of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod for stones of memorial unto the sons of Israel, and Aaron shall bear their names before the LORD upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the settings of gold
speaker: Narrator

text: and two small chains of pure gold; of wreathen work shalt thou make them and fasten the wreathen chains to the settings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the same manner thou shalt make the pectoral of judgment with cunning work; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it, of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and of fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be square and double; a span shall be the length thereof, and a span shall be the breadth thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt fill it with four rows of stones; The order shall be a ruby, an emerald, and a chrysolite; this shall be the first order.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second order shall be a carbuncle, a sapphire, and a diamond.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the third order, a topaz, a turquoise, and an amethyst.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fourth row a tarshish (or beryl) and an onyx and a jasper; they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those stones shall be in agreement with the names of the sons of Israel, twelve, in agreement with their names; each one in agreement with his name like the engravings of a seal; they shall be according to the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt also make upon the pectoral small chains of wreathen work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make upon the pectoral two rings of gold and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the pectoral.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the pectoral.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains thou shalt fasten in the two settings and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod on the front of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make two rings of gold, and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the pectoral in the border thereof, which is in the side of the ephod inward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise two other rings of gold thou shalt make and shalt put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the front part thereof, over against the other coupling thereof, above the special girdle of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall bind the pectoral by its rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be above the special girdle of the ephod and that the pectoral not be loosed from the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel in the pectoral of judgment upon his heart when he goes in unto the sanctuary for a memorial before the LORD continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put in the pectoral of judgment Urim and Thummim, that they shall be upon Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the LORD; and Aaron shall always bear the judgment of the sons of Israel upon his heart before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall have the collar of his head in the midst thereof, which shall have a binding of woven work round about it, as the collar of a habergeon, that it not be rent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And beneath upon the hem of it, thou shalt make pomegranates of blue and of purple and of scarlet round about the hem thereof and bells of gold between them round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: A golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate upon the hem of the robe round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be upon Aaron to minister, and his sound shall be heard when he goes in unto the sanctuary before the LORD and when he comes out, that he not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make an open flower of pure gold and engrave upon it the engravings of a seal, HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put it on with a blue lace that it may be upon the mitre; upon the forefront of the mitre it shall be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be upon Aaron’s forehead that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the sons of Israel shall sanctify in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead that they may find grace before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt embroider the coat of fine linen, and thou shalt make the mitre of fine linen, and thou shalt make the girdle of needlework.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for Aaron’s sons thou shalt make coats; thou shalt also make girdles for them, and tiaras shalt thou make for them, for honour and for beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with these thou shalt clothe Aaron, thy brother, and his sons with him and shalt anoint them and fill their hands and sanctify them that they may be my priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make them linen underwear to cover their nakedness; they shall reach from the loins even unto the thighs;
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be upon Aaron and upon his sons when they enter into the tabernacle of the testimony or when they come near unto the altar to serve in the sanctuary that they not bear iniquity and die: This shall be a perpetual statute unto him and his seed after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is what thou shalt do unto them to sanctify them that they shall be my priests: Take one young bullock and two perfect rams
speaker: Narrator

text: and unleavened bread and unleavened cakes tempered with oil and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, which thou shalt make of wheat flour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put them into a basket and offer them in the basket with the bullock and the two rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the testimony and shalt wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the garments and clothe Aaron with the coat and the robe of the ephod and the ephod and the pectoral and gird him with the special girdle of the ephod;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt put the mitre upon his head and put the crown of holiness upon the mitre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou take the anointing oil and pour it upon his head and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bring his sons and put coats upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt gird them with girdles, Aaron and his sons, and bind the tiaras on them; and the priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute; and thou shalt fill the hands Aaron and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cause the bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the testimony, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt kill the bullock before the LORD by the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock and put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger and pour all the remaining blood beside the bottom of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take all the fat that covers the intestines and the caul that is above the liver and the two kidneys and the fat that is upon them and burn them upon the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the flesh of the bullock and his skin and his dung shalt thou burn with fire outside the camp; it is sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt likewise take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take his blood and sprinkle it round about upon the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cut the ram in pieces and wash his intestines and his legs and put them upon his pieces and upon his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt offering unto the LORD: it is a sweet savour, an offering on fire unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou kill the ram and take of his blood and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron and upon the tip of the right ears of his sons and upon the thumb of their right hands and upon the great toe of their right feet and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take of the blood that shall be upon the altar and of the anointing oil and sprinkle it upon Aaron and upon his garments and upon his sons and upon their garments, and he shall be sanctified, and his garments and his sons and his sons’ garments with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the tail and the fat that covers the intestines and the caul above the liver and the two kidneys and the fat that is upon them and the right shoulder, for it is a ram of consecrations,
speaker: Narrator

text: Also one large loaf of bread and one cake of oiled bread and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the LORD;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt put all this in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons and shalt lift them up and wave them before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt take them from their hands and burn them upon the altar upon the burnt offering, for a sweet savour before the LORD. It is an offering on fire unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of the consecrations, which is of Aaron and wave it for a waved offering before the LORD; and it shall be thy part.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set apart the breast of the waved offering and the shoulder of the sanctification, that which was waved and that which was sanctified of the ram of the consecrations of Aaron and of his sons;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it shall be for Aaron and for his sons by a perpetual statute of the sons of Israel, for it is something set apart, and it shall be set apart of the sons of Israel of the sacrifice of their peace offerings; it shall be something of theirs set apart unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed with them and to be consecrated with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for seven days the priest of his sons, who in his stead shall come into the tabernacle of the testimony, shall put them on to serve in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the ram of the consecrations and cook his flesh in the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket by the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall eat those things with which they were reconciled, to fill their hands to be sanctified; but a stranger shall not eat thereof because they are holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if any of the flesh of the consecrations or of the bread remains unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire; it shall not be eaten, because it is holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus shalt thou do unto Aaron and to his sons, according to all the things which I have commanded thee; for seven days shalt thou consecrate them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt sacrifice a bullock every day for reconciliation of sin; and thou shalt remove the sin from the altar, and thou shalt anoint it to sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days thou shalt reconcile the altar and sanctify it; and it shall be a most holy altar; whatever touches the altar shall be made holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar: two lambs of the first year every day continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning, and the other lamb thou shalt offer at evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover a tenth ephah of flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil and the fourth part of a hin of wine with each lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt offer the other lamb at evening, doing according to the present of the morning and according to its drink offering thereof, for a sweet savour, an offering on fire unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your ages at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony before the LORD, where I will concert with you, to speak there unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there I will testify of myself unto the sons of Israel, and the place shall be sanctified with my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will sanctify the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar; I will likewise sanctify both Aaron and his sons that they may be my priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will dwell among the sons of Israel and shall be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them; I am the LORD your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon; of cedar wood shalt thou make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its length shall be a cubit and its width a cubit; it shall be square and its height two cubits; its horns shall be of the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cover it with pure gold, its top and its sides round about, and its horns; and thou shalt make unto it a moulding of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under its moulding by its two corners on both sides for places for the staves to bear it with.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the staves of cedar wood and cover them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, before the seat of reconciliation that is over the testimony, where I will testify unto thee of myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron shall burn sweet incense thereon every morning; when he dresses the lamps, he shall burn it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn incense upon it continually before the LORD throughout your ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon nor burnt sacrifice nor present; neither shall ye pour drink offering thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron shall make reconciliation upon the horns of it once a year with the blood of the reconciliation for sin; once a year shall he make reconciliation upon it throughout your ages; it shall be most holy unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou takest the number of the sons of Israel after the sum of them, each one shall give a ransom for his soul unto the LORD, when thou dost number them, that there be no mortality in them because of numbering them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be given by every one that passes among those that are numbered: half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary (a shekel is twenty gerahs); a half shekel shall be the offering to the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone that passes among those that are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give the offering unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when they give the offering unto the LORD to make reconciliation for your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the reconciliation money of the sons of Israel and shalt appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of the testimony, and it shall be a memorial unto the sons of Israel before the LORD to reconcile your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke further unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make a laver of brass, and its base also of brass, to wash with; and thou shalt place it between the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar, and thou shalt put water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from it Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they go into the tabernacle of the testimony, they shall wash with water that they not die, or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn the offering unto the LORD that must be consumed by fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they not die. And he and his seed shall have it as a perpetual statute throughout their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD spoke further unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou must take unto thee of the principal spices: of excellent myrrh five hundred shekels and of aromatic cinnamon half so much, even two hundred and fifty shekels, and of aromatic calamus two hundred and fifty shekels,
speaker: Narrator

text: and of cassia five hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of oil olive one hin;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt make of it the oil of the holy anointing, a superior ointment, after the art of the apothecary, which shall be the oil of the holy anointing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt anoint the tabernacle of the testimony with it and the ark of the testimony
speaker: Narrator

text: and the table and all its vessels and the lampstand and its vessels and the altar of incense
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels and the laver and its base.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus thou shalt consecrate them, and they shall be most holy; whatever touches them shall be sanctified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt also anoint Aaron and his sons and sanctify them that they may be my priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, This shall be my oil of the holy anointing throughout your ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be poured upon man’s flesh; neither shall ye make any other like it, after the composition of it; it is holy, and it shall be holy unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever compounds any like it and puts any of it upon a stranger shall be cut off from his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take unto thee aromas, stacte and onycha and aromatic galbanum and pure frankincense, of each in equal weight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make it a perfume, a confection after the art of the apothecary, tempered together, pure and holy;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt beat some of it very small and put of it before the testimony in the tabernacle of the testimony, where I will testify unto thee of myself. It shall be most holy unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the perfume which thou shalt make, ye shall not make to yourselves another according to the composition thereof: it shall be holiness unto thee for the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever shall make another like unto that to smell it shall be cut off from his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I have called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom and in intelligence and in science and in all manner of workmanship,
speaker: Narrator

text: to devise cunning works, to work in gold and in silver and in brass,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of timber, to work in all manner of workmanship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, behold, I have given with him Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the desire of all that are wise hearted I have put wisdom that they may make all that I have commanded thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: The tabernacle of the testimony and the ark of the testimony and the seat of reconciliation that shall be upon it and all the vessels of the tabernacle
speaker: Narrator

text: and the table and its vessels and the pure lampstand with all its vessels and the altar of incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels and the laver and its base
speaker: Narrator

text: and the clothes of service and the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons that they may be priests,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the anointing oil and aromatic incense for the sanctuary; they shall do according to all that I have commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke further unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, With all this ye shall keep my sabbaths; for it is a sign between me and you throughout your ages; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall keep the sabbath therefore; for it is holy unto you; those that defile it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shall work be done; but the seventh, the sabbath of rest, shall be holy to the LORD; whoever does any work in the sabbath day shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the sons of Israel shall keep the sabbath, to observe the sabbath throughout their ages for a perpetual covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a sign between me and the sons of Israel for ever; for in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave unto Moses, when he finished speaking with him upon Mount Sinai, two tables of the testimony, tables of stone, written with the finger of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down out of the mount, the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron and said unto him, Rise up, make us gods which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron said unto them, Break off the golden earrings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people broke off the golden earrings which were in their ears and brought them unto Aaron,
speaker: Narrator

text: who took them from their hands and fashioned it with a graving tool and made of it a molten calf. Then they said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seeing this, Aaron built an altar before the calf; and Aaron made a proclamation and said, Tomorrow shall be a feast unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they rose up early on the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink and rose up to play.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Go, descend; for thy people, which thou didst bring out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves:
speaker: Narrator

text: They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them; they have made themselves a molten calf and have worshipped it and have sacrificed unto it and said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD further said unto Moses, I have seen this people, and for certain it is a stiffnecked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore let me alone that my wrath may wax hot in them and consume them; and I will put thee over a great nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses grieved before the LORD his God and said, LORD, why shall thy wrath wax hot against thy people, which thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the Egyptians speak and say, For evil did he bring them out, to slay them in the mountains and to consume them from upon the face of the earth? Turn from thy fierce wrath and repent of the evil of thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, thy slaves, to whom thou didst sware by thine own self and hast said unto them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have spoken of will I give unto your seed, and they shall take it for inheritance for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD repented of the evil which he said should be done unto his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses turned and went down from the mount, and the two tables of the testimony were in his hand; the tables were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the tables were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, graven upon the tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua, hearing the noise of the people as they shouted, said unto Moses, There is a noise of war in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, It is not the voice of those that shout for mastery, neither is it the voice of those that cry for being overcome, but the noise of those that sing that I hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as soon as he came near unto the camp and he saw the calf and the dances, anger caused Moses to wax hot, and he cast the tables out of his hands and broke them at the foot of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took the calf which they had made and burnt it in the fire and ground it to powder and scattered it upon the waters and made the sons of Israel drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto Aaron, What did this people do unto thee that thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron answered, Let not the anger of my lord wax hot; thou knowest the people that they are inclined to evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they said unto me, Make us gods, which shall go before us, for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what is become of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I answered unto them, Whoever has any gold, let them break it off. So they gave it to me and I cast it into the fire, and this calf came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses saw that the people were naked (for Aaron had made them naked unto their shame among their enemies),
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses stood in the gate of the camp and said, Who is on the LORD’s side? Come unto me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Thus hath the LORD God of Israel said, Put every man his sword by his side and go in and out from gate to gate throughout the camp and slay each one his brother and his companion and his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses, and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses had said, Today you have consecrated yourselves to the LORD, for each one has consecrated in his son and in his brother, that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the next day that Moses said unto the people, Ye have sinned a great sin, but now I will go up unto the LORD; peradventure I shall make reconciliation for your sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses returned unto the LORD and said, I pray thee, for, this people who have sinned a great sin and have made themselves gods of gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou wilt forgive their sin; and if not, blot me now out of thy book which thou hast written.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD answered unto Moses, Whoever has sinned against me, this one will I blot out of my book.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore go now, lead the people unto the place of which I have spoken unto thee; behold, my Angel shall go before thee; nevertheless in the day of my visitation I will visit their sin in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD smote the people because they had made the calf, which Aaron formed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Depart and go up from here, thou and the people which thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt unto the land which I swore unto Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto the land flowing with milk and honey; for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked people lest I consume thee in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned, and no one put on their ornaments.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD had said unto Moses, Say unto the sons of Israel, Ye are a stiffnecked people; I will come up into the midst of thee in a moment and consume thee; therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee that I may know what to do unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments from Mount Horeb on.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses took the tabernacle and pitched it outside the camp, afar off from the camp, and called it the tabernacle of the testimony. And it came to pass that every one who sought the LORD went out unto the tabernacle of the testimony, which was outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when Moses would go out unto the tabernacle, that all the people would rise up and stand each one at the door of their tent, with their gaze following Moses until he was gone into the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses would enter into the tabernacle, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the door of the tabernacle, and the LORD would talk with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand at the tabernacle door, all the people would rise up, each one in the door of their tent, and worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD would speak unto Moses face to face, as anyone would speak unto their friend. And he would turn again into the camp, but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, did not depart out of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto the LORD, See, thou sayest unto me, Bring this people out, and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with me. Yet thou saith, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thy sight, show me now thy way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in thy sight; and consider that this nation is thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, My presence {Heb. faces} shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, If thy presence {Heb. faces} is not to go before us, do not bring us out of here.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in what shall it be known here that I have found grace in thy sight, I and thy people, but in that thou goest with us, and I and thy people will be separated from all the peoples that are upon the face of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, I will do this thing also that thou hast spoken because thou hast found grace in my sight, and I have known thee by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, I beseech thee, show me thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he replied, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and I will proclaim the name that I AM before thee; and I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy and will show clemency on whom I will show clemency.
speaker: Narrator

text: He further said, Thou canst not see my face; for no man shall see me and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD continued saying, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon the rock;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it shall come to pass while my glory passes by, that I will put thee in a cleft of the rock and will cover thee with my hand until I have passed by.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will take away my hand, and thou shalt see my back parts, but my face {Heb. faces} shall not be seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Hew two tables of stone like unto the first; and I will write upon these tables the words that were in the first tables, which thou didst break.
speaker: Narrator

text: And be ready for tomorrow and come up in the morning unto Mount Sinai and present thyself there to me in the top of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no man shall come up with thee; neither let anyone be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the sheep nor the cows feed before the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and Moses rose up early in the morning and went up unto Mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD descended in a cloud and was with him there proclaiming the name of I AM.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as the LORD passed by before him, he proclaimed, I AM, I AM strong, merciful, and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in mercy and truth,
speaker: Narrator

text: keeping mercy for thousands, letting go of iniquity and rebellion and sin; and by no means will I absolve the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons and upon the sons’ sons, unto the third and to the fourth generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses made haste and bowed his head toward the earth and worshipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O Lord, let my Lord, I pray thee, go among us, for this is a stiffnecked people, and forgive our iniquity and our sin and possess us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant before all thy people: I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among whom thou art shall see the work of the LORD; for it shall be a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep that which I command thee this day; behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where thou must enter lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: but ye shall destroy their altars, break their images, and cut down their groves;
speaker: Narrator

text: for thou shalt worship no other god; for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt not make a covenant with the inhabitants of that land because they shall fornicate after their gods and do sacrifice unto their gods, and they shall call thee, and thou shalt eat of their sacrifices
speaker: Narrator

text: or take of their daughters unto thy sons, and when their daughters go fornicating after their gods they shall make thy sons also fornicate after their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make thee no molten gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month Abib; for in the month Abib thou didst come out from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that opens the womb is mine; and every firstborn among thy livestock, whether of cow or of sheep, that is male.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the firstborn of an ass thou shalt ransom with a lamb, and if thou ransom him not, then shalt thou cut off his head. All the firstborn of thy sons thou shalt ransom, and none shall appear before me empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt cease; in ploughing time and in harvest thou shalt cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt keep the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of the reaping of the wheat, and the feast of ingathering at the year’s end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in the year shall all your males appear before the GOD who is Lord of all, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will cast the Gentiles out of thy presence and enlarge thy borders; neither shall anyone covet thy land when thou shalt go up to be seen before the LORD thy God three times a year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice upon anything leavened; neither shall any of the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left unto the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring unto the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not cook a kid in his mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write thou these words; for according to these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he did not eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses’ hand, while he came down from the mount, that Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone after he had talked with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Aaron and all the sons of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come near him.
speaker: Narrator
