text: And Moses called them, and Aaron and all the princes of the congregation returned unto him, and Moses talked with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward all the sons of Israel came near, and he gave them in commandment all that the LORD had spoken with him in Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he would take the veil off until he came out. And as he came out, he would speak unto the sons of Israel that which he was commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel would see the face of Moses that the skin of Moses’ face shone, and Moses would put the veil upon his face again until he would go in to speak with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses gathered all the congregation of the sons of Israel together and said unto them, These are the words which the LORD has commanded that ye should do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day shall be holy unto you, a sabbath of rest to the LORD; whoever does work therein shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall kindle no fire in any of your habitations upon the sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses spoke unto all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, This is what the LORD commanded, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take ye from among you an offering unto the LORD; whoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, an offering of the LORD: gold, silver, brass;
speaker: Narrator

text: blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats’ hair;
speaker: Narrator

text: rams’ skins dyed red, badgers’ skins, cedar wood;
speaker: Narrator

text: oil for the light, spices for anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod, and for the pectoral.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone that is wise hearted among you shall come and make all that the LORD has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: The tabernacle, its tent, and its covering, its hooks, and its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark and its staves, the seat of reconciliation, and the veil of the tent,
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and its staves and all its vessels, and the showbread;
speaker: Narrator

text: the lampstand also for the light and its vessels and its lamps, and the oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of incense and its staves, and the anointing oil, and the aromatic incense, and the hanging for the door at the entrance of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: the altar of burnt offering with its brasen grate, its staves, and all its vessels, the laver and its base,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the court, its pillars, and their sockets, and the hanging for the door of the court,
speaker: Narrator

text: the stakes of the tabernacle and the stakes of the court, and their cords,
speaker: Narrator

text: the clothing of service to minister in the sanctuary, that is, the holy garments of Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons to serve in the priesthood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the congregation of the sons of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came, every man whose heart stirred him up, and every one whose spirit made them willing, and they brought the LORD’s offering for the work of the tabernacle of the testimony and for all his service and for the holy garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, and brought chains and earrings, rings and bracelets, and all jewels of gold; and anyone that offered an offering of gold unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man who had blue or purple or scarlet or fine linen or goats’ hair or red skins of rams or badgers’ skins brought them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone that offered an offering of silver or brass brought the offering unto the LORD; and every man, with whom was found cedar wood, brought it for all the work of the service.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the women that were wise hearted spun with their hands and brought that which they had spun: blue or purple or scarlet or fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the women whose heart lifted them up in wisdom spun goats’ hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the princes brought onyx stones and the stones to be set for the ephod and for the pectoral;
speaker: Narrator

text: and aromatic spice and oil for the light and for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Israel, men and women, all that had a willing heart to bring for all the work, which the Lord had commanded to be made by the hand of Moses, brought a voluntary offering unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto the sons of Israel, See, the LORD has named Bezaleel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in intelligence, in science, and in all manner of workmanship;
speaker: Narrator

text: to invent and devise, to work in gold and in silver and in brass,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of wood, to make any manner of cunning work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has filled them with wisdom of heart to work all manner of work of the engraver and of the cunning workman and of the embroiderer, in blue and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver: that they may do any work, and invent every design.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab and every wise hearted man unto whom the LORD gave wisdom and intelligence to know how to do all the work of the service of the sanctuary, all the things that the LORD had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab and every wise hearted man in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom and every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they took from the presence of Moses all the offering which the sons of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it with. And they brought yet unto him free will offerings every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: So much that all the wise men that wrought all the work of the sanctuary came every man from his work which they made,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they spoke with Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the work of the ministry which the LORD commanded to make.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses commanded it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing,
speaker: Narrator

text: for they had abundant material for all the work; more than enough to make it with.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone with a wise heart among those that wrought the work made the tabernacle of ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet, which they made of cunning work, with cherubim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits; the curtains were all of one size.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he coupled the five curtains one unto another; and the other five curtains he coupled one unto another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain in the border in the coupling; likewise he made in the border of the second curtain in the coupling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the second curtain in the border in the coupling, the loops in front of the others.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made fifty hooks of gold and coupled the curtains one unto another with the hooks, so it became one tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he made curtains of goats’ hair for the tent over the tabernacle; he made eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain; the eleven curtains were of one size.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he coupled five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made fifty loops upon the edge of the uttermost curtain in the coupling, and he made another fifty loops upon the edge of the other curtain in the coupling.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he also made fifty hooks of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and another covering of badgers’ skins above that.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the boards for the tabernacle of cedar wood, standing up.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each board was ten cubits, and the breadth one cubit and a half.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each board had two tenons, equally distant one from another; thus did he make all the boards of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made, therefore, the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side towards the Negev.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two tenons and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the other side of the tabernacle, on the side of the Aquilon, {the north wind} he made twenty boards,
speaker: Narrator

text: with their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the westward side of the tabernacle he made six boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides,
speaker: Narrator

text: which were coupled beneath and likewise coupled together above to a ring; thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were, therefore, eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he also made bars of cedar wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the westward side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the middle bar to pass through the boards from the one end to the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he covered the boards with gold and made their rings of gold for the bars to pass through and covered the bars with gold also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he made the veil of blue and purple and scarlet and fine twined linen, which he made with cherubim of cunning work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for it he made four pillars of cedar and covered them with gold; their capitals were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he made the veil for the tabernacle door of blue and purple and scarlet and fine twined linen, of needlework,
speaker: Narrator

text: and its five pillars with their capitals; and he covered their heads and their fillets with gold; and their five sockets he made of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezaleel also made the ark of cedar wood; two cubits and a half was the length of it, a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he covered it with pure gold within and without and made a moulding of gold to it round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it: even two rings upon the one side of it and two rings upon the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the staves of cedar wood and covered them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the seat of reconciliation likewise of pure gold; two cubits and a half was its length, and one cubit and a half its breadth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the two cherubim of gold, beaten out of one piece he made them, on the two ends of the seat of reconciliation;
speaker: Narrator

text: one cherub on the end on this side and another cherub on the other end on that side of the seat of reconciliation; he made the cherubim on the two ends thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cherubim spread out their wings above, covering with their wings the seat of reconciliation, with their faces one to another; the faces of the cherubim were facing the covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the table of cedar wood; two cubits was the length thereof and a cubit the breadth thereof and a cubit and a half the height thereof;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he covered it with pure gold and made it a moulding of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made it a border of a handbreadth round about and made a moulding of gold for the border thereof round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cast for it four rings of gold and put the rings upon the four corners that correspond to the four feet thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over against the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the staves of cedar wood and covered them with gold, to bear the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the vessels which were upon the table, its dishes, its spoons, its bowls, and its covers to cover the bread, of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the lampstand likewise of pure gold; of beaten work he made the lampstand, its shaft and its branch, its bowls, its knops, and its flowers were of the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the sides thereof went six branches, three branches out of one side of the lampstand and three branches out of the other side of the lampstand;
speaker: Narrator

text: in one branch there were three bowls made after the fashion of almonds, a knop and a flower; and in the other branch there were three bowls made like almonds, a knop and a flower, so throughout the six branches going out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the lampstand were four bowls made like almonds, their knops, and their flowers,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a knop under the two branches of the same and another knop under two branches of the same and a knop under the two other branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their knops and their branches were of the same; all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made likewise its seven lamps and its snuffers and its snuff dishes of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a talent of pure gold he made it and all its vessels.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the altar of incense of cedar wood: the length of it was a cubit and the breadth of it a cubit; it was square; and two cubits was the height of it; its horns were of the same piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he covered it with pure gold, its top and its sides round about and its horns; and he made it a moulding of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made two rings of gold for it under the moulding thereof, by the two corners of it, upon its two sides, to be places for the staves to bear it with.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the staves of cedar wood and covered them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made likewise the oil of the holy anointing and the pure aromatic incense, according to the work of the apothecary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the altar of burnt offering of cedar wood: five cubits was its length and five cubits its breadth; it was square, and its height was three cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made its horns on the four corners of it; its horns were of the same piece; and he covered it with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made likewise all the vessels of the altar: the pots and the shovels and the basins and the fleshhooks, and the firepans; all its vessels he made of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for the altar the brasen grate of network under the circumference thereof beneath unto the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, to be places for the staves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the staves of cedar wood and covered them with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it with; he made the altar hollow with boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the laver of brass and the base of it of brass, of the looking glasses of the women who were vigilant at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the court likewise; on the south side towards the Negev the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, one hundred cubits;
speaker: Narrator

text: their pillars were twenty with their twenty brasen sockets; the capitals of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the side of the Aquilon, the hangings were one hundred cubits, their pillars twenty with their twenty sockets of brass, the capitals of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten and their sockets ten, the capitals of the pillars and their fillets of silver,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the east side eastward fifty cubits
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the one side fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits, their pillars three and their sockets three.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sockets for the pillars were of brass, the capitals of the pillars and their fillets of silver and the coverings of their heads of silver; likewise all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hanging for the gate of the court was needlework of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen; twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, the same as the hangings of the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: And its pillars were four with its four sockets of brass, their capitals of silver, and the coverings of their heads and their fillets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the stakes of the tabernacle and of the court round about were of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the ministry of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bezaleel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him was Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, a master workman, an engineer, and an embroiderer in blue and in purple and in scarlet and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, which was gold of offering, was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred and thirty shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the silver of those that were numbered of the congregation was one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary:
speaker: Narrator

text: A half per head, that is, half a shekel, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, which were six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary and the sockets of the veil: one hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made the capitals for the pillars and covered their heads and filleted them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the brass of the offering was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels,
speaker: Narrator

text: with which he made the sockets to the door of the tabernacle of the testimony and the brasen altar and the brasen grate for it and all the vessels of the altar
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sockets of the court round about and the sockets of the court gate and all the stakes of the tabernacle, and all the stakes of the court round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the blue and purple and scarlet, they made the clothing of the ministry, to minister in the sanctuary, and in the same manner they made the holy garments for Aaron; as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they beat the gold into thin plates and cut it into wires to work it in the blue and in the purple and in the scarlet and in the fine linen, with cunning work.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the shoulder pieces for it to couple it together; by the two edges was it coupled together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the special girdle of his ephod, that was over it, was of the same, according to the work thereof: of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in settings of gold, graven, as seals are graven, with the names of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod that they should be stones for a memorial to the sons of Israel, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the pectoral of cunning work, like the work of the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was square; they made the pectoral double; a span was the length thereof and a span the breadth thereof, being doubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they set in it four orders of stones. The order was a ruby, an emerald, and a chrysolite: this was the first order.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second order, a carbuncle, a sapphire, and a diamond.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third order, a topaz, a turquoise, and an amethyst.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fourth order, a tarshish (or beryl), an onyx, and a jasper; they were set and inclosed in their settings of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stones were in agreement with the names of the sons of Israel, twelve, in agreement with their names, like the engravings of a seal, each one in agreement with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also made the small chains upon the pectoral of wreathen work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner they made two settings of gold and two gold rings and put the two rings in the two ends of the pectoral.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in those two rings on the ends of the pectoral.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the two ends of the two wreathen chains they fastened in the two settings, which they put on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, on the front part of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made two rings of gold and put them on the two ends of the pectoral upon the border of it, which was on the lower side of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made two other golden rings and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath toward the front part of it, in the front of its coupling, above the special girdle of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they bound the pectoral by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue lace, that it might be above the special girdle of the ephod and that the pectoral might not be loosed from the ephod, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue,
speaker: Narrator

text: with its collar in the midst of the robe, as the collar of a habergeon, with a band round about the collar that it should not rend.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also made the bells of pure gold and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;
speaker: Narrator

text: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister in, as the LORD commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made the coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron and for his sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: likewise the mitre of fine linen and the decorations of the tiaras of fine linen and the linen underwear of fine twined linen,
speaker: Narrator

text: also the girdle of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet of needlework, as the LORD commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made the open flower, the crown of holiness, of pure gold and wrote upon it a writing, like to the engravings of a seal, HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they tied unto it a lace of blue to fasten it over the mitre, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus was all the work of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony finished, and the sons of Israel did according to all that the LORD had commanded Moses, so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tabernacle and all its furniture, its hooks, its boards, its bars and its pillars and its sockets,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the covering of rams’ skins dyed red and the covering of badgers’ skins and the veil of the curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark of the testimony and its staves, and the seat of reconciliation,
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and all its vessels, and the showbread,
speaker: Narrator

text: the pure lampstand with its lamps, even with the lamps to be set in order, and all its vessels and the oil for light,
speaker: Narrator

text: the golden altar and the anointing oil and the aromatic incense and the hanging for the tabernacle door.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brasen altar with its grate of brass, its staves, and all its vessels, and the laver and its base.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings of the court, its pillars and its sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, its cords and its stakes, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tabernacle of the testimony,
speaker: Narrator

text: the clothing of service for ministry in the sanctuary, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest and his sons’ garments, to minister in the priesthood.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all that the LORD had commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel made all the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses looked upon all the work, and, behold, they had done it as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it; and Moses blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day of the first month, the first of the month shalt thou set up the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony and cover the ark with the veil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bring in the table and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it, and thou shalt bring in the lampstand and light its lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle, of the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the laver between the tabernacle of the congregation and the altar and shalt put water therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Last, thou shalt set up the court round about and hang up the hanging at the court gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it and shalt sanctify it with all its vessels, and it shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt also anoint the altar of the burnt offering and all its vessels and sanctify the altar, and it shall be an altar most holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner thou shalt anoint the laver and its base and sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tabernacle of the testimony and wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments and anoint him and sanctify him, that he may be my priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bring his sons and clothe them with coats.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt anoint them as thou didst anoint their father, and they shall be my priests; and it shall be that their anointing shall be unto them for a perpetual priesthood throughout their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus did Moses; according to all that the LORD commanded him, so did he.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the first month in the second year on the first day of the month that the tabernacle was raised up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses caused the tabernacle to be raised up and fastened its sockets and set up its boards and put in its bars and caused its pillars to be raised up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent above upon it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took and put the testimony into the ark and set the staves on the ark and put the seat of reconciliation upon the ark above,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he brought the ark into the tabernacle and set up the veil of the curtain and covered the ark of the testimony, as the LORD commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the table in the tabernacle of the testimony, upon the side of the Aquilon of the tabernacle, outside the veil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the bread in order upon it before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the lampstand in the tabernacle of the testimony, over against the table, on the side of the Negev of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lighted the lamps before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also put the golden altar in the tabernacle of the testimony before the veil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he burnt aromatic incense on it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner he set up the hanging at the door of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the altar of burnt offering by the door of the tabernacle, of the tabernacle of the testimony, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the present, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the laver between the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar and put water in it, to wash with.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron and his sons would wash their hands and their feet in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they would enter into the tabernacle of the testimony and when they would come near unto the altar, they washed themselves, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Last he raised up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar and set up the hanging of the court gate. Thus Moses finished the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a cloud covered the tabernacle of the testimony, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was not able to enter into the tabernacle of the testimony because the cloud was upon it, and the glory of the LORD had it full.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the cloud lifted itself up from over the tabernacle, the sons of Israel went onward in all their journeys;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if the cloud did not lift itself up, then they did not journey until the day that it lifted itself up.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cloud of the LORD was upon the tabernacle by day, and the fire was in it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
speaker: Narrator
